faq.question: I have checked out a working copy of xml-forrest CVS, now what?

answer.p: Run "./build.sh docs" to see the documentation for Forrest. The documentation is generated in the build/site/ directory. Logfiles are in the build/tmp/context/WEB-INF/logs/ directory.

faq.question: When running ./build.sh in cygwin, I get an error: cygpath.exe: *** can't create title mutex, Win32 error 6.

answer.p: This appears to be a bug in cygwin. Please use the .bat script instead.

faq.question: Why is build docs failing on subsequent builds?

answer.p: It is a bug. Workaround: ./build.sh clean docs every time. There is an entry on the To Do List.

faq.question: When building my project, I get an validation error: Document root element "site", must match DOCTYPE root "null"..

answer.p: You are probably trying to build the project with an old version of Forrest (built before 2003-01-08) that is incorrectly trying to validate the site.xml file. If so, please update your Forrest installation.

Alternatively, you may be building with an up-to-date Forrest, but have overridden forrest.validate.xdocs.excludes in forrest.properties. With the introduction of site.xml, the above property must have site.xml listed to prevent an attempt at DTD-based validation.

faq.question: I gather that I will be able to use the Forrest infrastructure to build my own website.

answer.p: That is correct. Many of us want to do that, and that is partially why we are working here. Forrest is designed to not only build websites for the various Apache projects, but also so that you can apply your own skins to your own content. Try this ... "./build.sh clean docs -Duse.skin=basic" then copy the basic skin to make your own.
The forrestbot is under-development to automate the production of your documentation.

faq.question: Why am I a little confused by the Forrest documentation?

answer.p: Sorry, we are working on that for the next release. Forrest development has been very fast recently. Some of the documentation refers to old methods. Your best bet is to start with the Using Forrest document.
